page.title: 11Ditcham Park, S Buriton
page.content: Ditcham House estate was mentioned in the Domesday book and is known to have been the site of an manor house from the 16th century. Mr L Trent Cave a local benefactor bought the estate in 1887 and had the existing building pulled down and replaced with a large Victorian house, which was destroyed by fire before it was occupied. Another house was built. The architect was Sir Reginald Bromfield who also designed an English church in Copenhagen. It was furnished with purchases made in Italy and included a bathroom with a covered bath so as not to offend the eye. Mr Trent Cave founded St Lawrence RC church in Petersfield. He was a distinguished meteorologist who released balloons from Ditcham to record temperature and humidity of the upper atmosphere to assist the development of flying.
